title: Introducing: CREEP
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/creep.jpg "creep")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/7052-introducing-creep/attachment/creep)

For a group that have gained a significant profile over the last few months, [**CREEP**](http://www.officialcreep.com) are a band that have yet to grace the pages of **Crack in the Road**. This was largely down to the complete lack of material online. After watching them live last night however I was compelled to write about them regardless. The set was full of elegantly eerie visuals and a confident mixture of styles. Mixing elements of dubstep and witchhaus, **CREEP** on paper sound like a lot of bands doing the rounds at present, but it’s their attempt to embrace a more ambitious, orchestral like sound that’s making them stand out. This was even more evident when played live, they came complete with a superb cello player, who effortlessly gave the sound a clarity that no lo-fi spooky ass shit can come close to. Expect a full review of the show tomorrow.

 [CREEP / Days](http://soundcloud.com/youngturks/creep-days) by [Young Turks](http://soundcloud.com/youngturks)
